column4: I have a serious error with add/remove. The applicaiton does not prompt for super user password on start up, and can't read the settings
do other software installation methods work?
I will test, but it seems like add/remove can't read the settings
also, do you have root account enabled, and if so, why?
I do not have root account enabled, but normally I need to type in admin password to start add/remove
ok, your own?
yes
But add/remove have stopped prompting me
It seems that I have a "broken" package. sun-java6-plugin
did you get instructions on how to fix it?
I reinstalled sun-java6-plugin and add/remove works. Should I post a bug or something?
search launchpad first for bug reports
ok
What should i search for?
sun-java6-plugin :-)
Where can I find the log for add/remove, if there is any
The bug might be because something went wrong under the installation of sun-java6-plugin. When I tried again it installed successful. This might be caused by the userunfriendliness of add/remove.
if you think it's a bug, then by all means, file it
Not a bug, but add/remove should be changed so it don't stop working when a package is broken
if it doesn't work as you expected it to work, then it's a bug ;-)
How do I post that kind of bugs?:-)
as you would any other
